trans-unit.source: Copy Blob
trans-unit.target: Copy Blob

trans-unit.source: Copy Blob
trans-unit.target: Copy Blob

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation copies a blob to a destination within the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation copies a blob to a destination within the storage account.

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-21 and later, the source for a Copy Blob operation can be a committed blob in any Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-21 and later, the source for a Copy Blob operation can be a committed blob in any Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2015-02-21, the source for a <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> operation can be an Azure file in any Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2015-02-21, the source for a <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> operation can be an Azure file in any Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.
trans-unit.target: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account, <parameterReference>mycontainer</parameterReference> with the name of your container, and <parameterReference>myblob</parameterReference> with the name of your destination blob.
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account, <parameterReference>mycontainer</parameterReference> with the name of your container, and <parameterReference>myblob</parameterReference> with the name of your destination blob.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, you may specify a shared access signature for the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, you may specify a shared access signature for the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: PUT Method Request URI
trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service URI

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob.

trans-unit.source: If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file.
trans-unit.target: If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file.

trans-unit.source: Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Containers and Blobs</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Containers and Blobs</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the source blob has been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the source blob has been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the source blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the source blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.
trans-unit.target: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the source blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the source blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the source blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the source blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.
trans-unit.target: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the source blob only if its ETag matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the source blob only if its ETag matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the ETag values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the ETag values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.
trans-unit.target: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if its ETag does not match the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if its ETag does not match the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.
trans-unit.target: This header cannot be specified if the source is an Azure File.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the destination blob has been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the destination blob has been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the destination blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to copy the blob only if the destination blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to copy the blob only if the specified ETag value matches the <parameterReference>ETag</parameterReference> value for an existing destination blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to copy the blob only if the specified ETag value matches the <parameterReference>ETag</parameterReference> value for an existing destination blob.

trans-unit.source: If the ETag for the destination blob does not match the ETag specified for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the ETag for the destination blob does not match the ETag specified for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).
trans-unit.target: An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to copy the blob only if the specified ETag value does not match the ETag value for the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to copy the blob only if the specified ETag value does not match the ETag value for the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the destination blob does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the destination blob does not exist.

trans-unit.source: If the specified condition isn't met, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the specified condition isn't met, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the source blob or file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the source blob or file.

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, this value is a URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies a blob.
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, this value is a URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies a blob.

trans-unit.source: The value should be URL-encoded as it would appear in a request URI.
trans-unit.target: The value should be URL-encoded as it would appear in a request URI.

trans-unit.source: A source blob in the same account can be private, but a blob in another account must be public or accept credentials included in this URL, such as a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: A source blob in the same account can be private, but a blob in another account must be public or accept credentials included in this URL, such as a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.
trans-unit.target: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft recommends using HTTPS when possible.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft recommends using HTTPS when possible.

trans-unit.source: Examples:
trans-unit.target: Examples:

trans-unit.source: In version 2015-02-21 and newer, the source can be a file that resides on an Azure File share.
trans-unit.target: In version 2015-02-21 and newer, the source can be a file that resides on an Azure File share.

trans-unit.source: When copying from a file, the source URL can use the following formats:
trans-unit.target: When copying from a file, the source URL can use the following formats:

trans-unit.source: In versions before 2012-02-12, blobs can only be copied within the same account, and a source name can use these formats:
trans-unit.target: In versions before 2012-02-12, blobs can only be copied within the same account, and a source name can use these formats:

trans-unit.source: Blob in named container: <codeInline>/accountName/containerName/blobName</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Blob in named container: <codeInline>/accountName/containerName/blobName</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Snapshot in named container: <codeInline>/accountName/containerName/blobName?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Snapshot in named container: <codeInline>/accountName/containerName/blobName?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Blob in root container: <codeInline>/accountName/blobName</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Blob in root container: <codeInline>/accountName/blobName</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Snapshot in root container: <codeInline>/accountName/blobName?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Snapshot in root container: <codeInline>/accountName/blobName?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Required if the destination blob has an active lease.
trans-unit.target: Required if the destination blob has an active lease.

trans-unit.source: The lease ID specified for this header must match the lease ID of the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: The lease ID specified for this header must match the lease ID of the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: If the request does not include the lease ID or it is not valid, the operation fails with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the request does not include the lease ID or it is not valid, the operation fails with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: If this header is specified and the destination blob does not currently have an active lease, the operation will also fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If this header is specified and the destination blob does not currently have an active lease, the operation will also fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, this value must specify an active, infinite lease for a leased blob.
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, this value must specify an active, infinite lease for a leased blob.

trans-unit.source: A finite-duration lease ID fails with 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: A finite-duration lease ID fails with 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional, versions before 2012-02-12 (unsupported in 2012-02-12 and newer).
trans-unit.target: Optional, versions before 2012-02-12 (unsupported in 2012-02-12 and newer).

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation only if the lease ID given matches the active lease ID of the source blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation only if the lease ID given matches the active lease ID of the source blob.

trans-unit.source: If this header is specified and the source blob does not currently have an active lease, the operation will also fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If this header is specified and the source blob does not currently have an active lease, the operation will also fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, a successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, a successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).

trans-unit.source: In versions before 2012-02-12, a successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: In versions before 2012-02-12, a successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response header
trans-unit.target: Response header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, if the copy is complete, contains the ETag of the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, if the copy is complete, contains the ETag of the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: If the copy isn’t complete, contains the ETag of the empty blob created at the start of the copy.
trans-unit.target: If the copy isn’t complete, contains the ETag of the empty blob created at the start of the copy.

trans-unit.source: In versions before 2012-02-12, returns the ETag for the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: In versions before 2012-02-12, returns the ETag for the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: In version 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.
trans-unit.target: In version 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

trans-unit.source: Returns the date/time that the copy operation to the destination blob completed.
trans-unit.target: Returns the date/time that the copy operation to the destination blob completed.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Version 2012-02-12 and newer.
trans-unit.target: Version 2012-02-12 and newer.

trans-unit.source: String identifier for this copy operation.
trans-unit.target: String identifier for this copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Use with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Abort Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to abort a pending copy.
trans-unit.target: Use with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Abort Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to abort a pending copy.

trans-unit.source: Version 2012-02-12 and newer.
trans-unit.target: Version 2012-02-12 and newer.

trans-unit.source: State of the copy operation, with these values:
trans-unit.target: State of the copy operation, with these values:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>success</parameterReference>: the copy completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>success</parameterReference>: the copy completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>pending</parameterReference>: the copy is in progress.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>pending</parameterReference>: the copy is in progress.

trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: This operation can be called by the account owner.
trans-unit.target: This operation can be called by the account owner.

trans-unit.source: For requests made against version 2013-08-15 and later, a shared access signature that has permission to write to the destination blob or its container is supported for copy operations within the same account.
trans-unit.target: For requests made against version 2013-08-15 and later, a shared access signature that has permission to write to the destination blob or its container is supported for copy operations within the same account.

trans-unit.source: Note that the shared access signature specified on the request applies only to the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: Note that the shared access signature specified on the request applies only to the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: Access to the source blob or file is authorized separately, as described in the details for the request header <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-source</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Access to the source blob or file is authorized separately, as described in the details for the request header <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-source</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation can complete asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: In version 2012-02-12 and newer, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation can complete asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: This operation returns a copy ID you can use to check or abort the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: This operation returns a copy ID you can use to check or abort the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service copies blobs on a best-effort basis.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service copies blobs on a best-effort basis.

trans-unit.source: The source blob for a copy operation may be a block blob, an append blob, or a page blob, or a snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The source blob for a copy operation may be a block blob, an append blob, or a page blob, or a snapshot.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob already exists, it must be of the same blob type as the source blob.
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob already exists, it must be of the same blob type as the source blob.

trans-unit.source: Any existing destination blob will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: Any existing destination blob will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob cannot be modified while a copy operation is in progress.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob cannot be modified while a copy operation is in progress.

trans-unit.source: In version 2015-02-21 and newer, the source for the copy operation may also be a file in the Azure File service.
trans-unit.target: In version 2015-02-21 and newer, the source for the copy operation may also be a file in the Azure File service.

trans-unit.source: If the source is a file, the destination must be a block blob.
trans-unit.target: If the source is a file, the destination must be a block blob.

trans-unit.source: Multiple pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operations within an account might be processed sequentially.
trans-unit.target: Multiple pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operations within an account might be processed sequentially.

trans-unit.source: A destination blob can only have one outstanding copy blob operation.
trans-unit.target: A destination blob can only have one outstanding copy blob operation.

trans-unit.source: In other words, a blob cannot be the destination for multiple pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operations.
trans-unit.target: In other words, a blob cannot be the destination for multiple pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operations.

trans-unit.source: An attempt to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to a destination blob that already has a copy pending fails with status code 409 (Conflict).
trans-unit.target: An attempt to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to a destination blob that already has a copy pending fails with status code 409 (Conflict).

trans-unit.source: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.
trans-unit.target: Only storage accounts created on or after June 7th, 2012 allow the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation to copy from another storage account.

trans-unit.source: An attempt to copy from another storage account to an account created before June 7th, 2012 fails with status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: An attempt to copy from another storage account to an account created before June 7th, 2012 fails with status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation always copies the entire source blob or file; copying a range of bytes or set of blocks is not supported.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation always copies the entire source blob or file; copying a range of bytes or set of blocks is not supported.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation can take any of the following forms:
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation can take any of the following forms:

trans-unit.source: You can copy a source blob to a destination blob with a different name.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a source blob to a destination blob with a different name.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob can be an existing blob of the same blob type (block, append, or page), or can be a new blob created by the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob can be an existing blob of the same blob type (block, append, or page), or can be a new blob created by the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: You can copy a source blob to a destination blob with the same name, effectively replacing the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a source blob to a destination blob with the same name, effectively replacing the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: Such a copy operation removes any uncommitted blocks and overwrites the blob's metadata.
trans-unit.target: Such a copy operation removes any uncommitted blocks and overwrites the blob's metadata.

trans-unit.source: You can copy a source file in the Azure File service to a destination blob.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a source file in the Azure File service to a destination blob.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob can be an existing block blob, or can be a new block blob created by the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob can be an existing block blob, or can be a new block blob created by the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Copying from files to page blobs or append blobs is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Copying from files to page blobs or append blobs is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You can copy a snapshot over its base blob.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a snapshot over its base blob.

trans-unit.source: By promoting a snapshot to the position of the base blob, you can restore an earlier version of a blob.
trans-unit.target: By promoting a snapshot to the position of the base blob, you can restore an earlier version of a blob.

trans-unit.source: You can copy a snapshot to a destination blob with a different name.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a snapshot to a destination blob with a different name.

trans-unit.source: The resulting destination blob is a writeable blob and not a snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The resulting destination blob is a writeable blob and not a snapshot.

trans-unit.source: When copying from a page blob, the Blob service creates a destination page blob of the source blob’s length, initially containing all zeroes.
trans-unit.target: When copying from a page blob, the Blob service creates a destination page blob of the source blob’s length, initially containing all zeroes.

trans-unit.source: Then the source page ranges are enumerated, and non-empty ranges are copied.
trans-unit.target: Then the source page ranges are enumerated, and non-empty ranges are copied.

trans-unit.source: For a block blob or an append blob, the Blob service creates a committed blob of zero length before returning from this operation.
trans-unit.target: For a block blob or an append blob, the Blob service creates a committed blob of zero length before returning from this operation.

trans-unit.source: When copying from a block blob, all committed blocks and their block IDs are copied.
trans-unit.target: When copying from a block blob, all committed blocks and their block IDs are copied.

trans-unit.source: Uncommitted blocks are not copied.
trans-unit.target: Uncommitted blocks are not copied.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the copy operation, the destination blob will have the same committed block count as the source.
trans-unit.target: At the end of the copy operation, the destination blob will have the same committed block count as the source.

trans-unit.source: When copying from an append blob, all committed blocks are copied.
trans-unit.target: When copying from an append blob, all committed blocks are copied.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the copy operation, the destination blob will have the same committed block count as the source.
trans-unit.target: At the end of the copy operation, the destination blob will have the same committed block count as the source.

trans-unit.source: For all blob types, you can call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the destination blob to check the status of the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: For all blob types, you can call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the destination blob to check the status of the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: The final blob will be committed when the copy completes.
trans-unit.target: The final blob will be committed when the copy completes.

trans-unit.source: When the source of a copy operation provides ETags, if there are any changes to the source while the copy is in progress, the copy will fail.
trans-unit.target: When the source of a copy operation provides ETags, if there are any changes to the source while the copy is in progress, the copy will fail.

trans-unit.source: An attempt to change the destination blob while a copy is in progress will fail with 409 Conflict.
trans-unit.target: An attempt to change the destination blob while a copy is in progress will fail with 409 Conflict.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob has an infinite lease, the lease ID must be passed to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob has an infinite lease, the lease ID must be passed to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Finite-duration leases are not allowed.
trans-unit.target: Finite-duration leases are not allowed.

trans-unit.source: The ETag for a block blob changes when the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is initiated and when the copy finishes.
trans-unit.target: The ETag for a block blob changes when the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is initiated and when the copy finishes.

trans-unit.source: The ETag for a page blob changes when the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is initiated, and continues to change frequently during the copy.
trans-unit.target: The ETag for a page blob changes when the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is initiated, and continues to change frequently during the copy.

trans-unit.source: The contents of a block blob are only visible using a GET after the full copy completes.
trans-unit.target: The contents of a block blob are only visible using a GET after the full copy completes.

trans-unit.source: Copying Blob Properties and Metadata
trans-unit.target: Copying Blob Properties and Metadata

trans-unit.source: When a blob is copied, the following system properties are copied to the destination blob with the same values:
trans-unit.target: When a blob is copied, the following system properties are copied to the destination blob with the same values:

trans-unit.source: The source blob's committed block list is also copied to the destination blob, if the blob is a block blob.
trans-unit.target: The source blob's committed block list is also copied to the destination blob, if the blob is a block blob.

trans-unit.source: Any uncommitted blocks are not copied.
trans-unit.target: Any uncommitted blocks are not copied.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob is always the same size as the source blob, so the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header for the destination blob matches that for the source blob.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob is always the same size as the source blob, so the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header for the destination blob matches that for the source blob.

trans-unit.source: When the source blob and destination blob are the same, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> removes any uncommitted blocks.
trans-unit.target: When the source blob and destination blob are the same, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> removes any uncommitted blocks.

trans-unit.source: If metadata is specified in this case, the existing metadata is overwritten with the new metadata.
trans-unit.target: If metadata is specified in this case, the existing metadata is overwritten with the new metadata.

trans-unit.source: Copying a Leased Blob
trans-unit.target: Copying a Leased Blob

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation only reads from the source blob so the lease state of the source blob does not matter.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation only reads from the source blob so the lease state of the source blob does not matter.

trans-unit.source: However, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation saves the ETag of the source blob when the copy is initiated.
trans-unit.target: However, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation saves the ETag of the source blob when the copy is initiated.

trans-unit.source: If the ETag value changes before the copy completes, the copy fails.
trans-unit.target: If the ETag value changes before the copy completes, the copy fails.

trans-unit.source: You can prevent changes to the source blob by leasing it during the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: You can prevent changes to the source blob by leasing it during the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob has an active infinite lease, you must specify its lease ID in the call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob has an active infinite lease, you must specify its lease ID in the call to the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.

trans-unit.source: If the lease you specify is an active finite-duration lease, this call fails with a status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the lease you specify is an active finite-duration lease, this call fails with a status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: While the copy is pending, any lease operation on the destination blob will fail with status code 409 (Conflict).
trans-unit.target: While the copy is pending, any lease operation on the destination blob will fail with status code 409 (Conflict).

trans-unit.source: An infinite lease on the destination blob is locked in this way during the copy operation whether you are copying to a destination blob with a different name from the source, copying to a destination blob with the same name as the source, or promoting a snapshot over its base blob.
trans-unit.target: An infinite lease on the destination blob is locked in this way during the copy operation whether you are copying to a destination blob with a different name from the source, copying to a destination blob with the same name as the source, or promoting a snapshot over its base blob.

trans-unit.source: If the client specifies a lease ID on a blob that does not yet exist, the Blob service will return status code 412 (Precondition Failed) for requests made against version 2013-08-15 and later; for prior versions the Blob service will return status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: If the client specifies a lease ID on a blob that does not yet exist, the Blob service will return status code 412 (Precondition Failed) for requests made against version 2013-08-15 and later; for prior versions the Blob service will return status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: Copying Snapshots
trans-unit.target: Copying Snapshots

trans-unit.source: When a source blob is copied, any snapshots of the source blob are not copied to the destination.
trans-unit.target: When a source blob is copied, any snapshots of the source blob are not copied to the destination.

trans-unit.source: When a destination blob is overwritten with a copy, any snapshots associated with the destination blob stay intact under its name.
trans-unit.target: When a destination blob is overwritten with a copy, any snapshots associated with the destination blob stay intact under its name.

trans-unit.source: You can perform a copy operation to promote a snapshot blob over its base blob.
trans-unit.target: You can perform a copy operation to promote a snapshot blob over its base blob.

trans-unit.source: In this way you can restore an earlier version of a blob.
trans-unit.target: In this way you can restore an earlier version of a blob.

trans-unit.source: The snapshot remains, but its destination is overwritten with a copy that can be both read and written.
trans-unit.target: The snapshot remains, but its destination is overwritten with a copy that can be both read and written.

trans-unit.source: Working with a Pending Copy (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: Working with a Pending Copy (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation completes the copy asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation completes the copy asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to determine the next step based on the status code returned by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>:
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to determine the next step based on the status code returned by <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>:

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: Meaning
trans-unit.target: Meaning

trans-unit.source: 202 (Accepted), x-ms-copy-status: success
trans-unit.target: 202 (Accepted), x-ms-copy-status: success

trans-unit.source: Copy completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: Copy completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: 202 (Accepted), x-ms-copy-status: pending
trans-unit.target: 202 (Accepted), x-ms-copy-status: pending

trans-unit.source: Copy has not completed.
trans-unit.target: Copy has not completed.

trans-unit.source: Poll the destination blob using <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to examine the x-ms-copy-status until copy completes or fails.
trans-unit.target: Poll the destination blob using <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get Blob Properties</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to examine the x-ms-copy-status until copy completes or fails.

trans-unit.source: Copy failed.
trans-unit.target: Copy failed.

trans-unit.source: During and after a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, the properties of the destination blob contain the copy ID of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation and URL of the source blob.
trans-unit.target: During and after a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, the properties of the destination blob contain the copy ID of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation and URL of the source blob.

trans-unit.source: When the copy completes, the Blob service writes the time and outcome value (<languageKeyword>success</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>aborted</languageKeyword>) to the destination blob properties.
trans-unit.target: When the copy completes, the Blob service writes the time and outcome value (<languageKeyword>success</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>aborted</languageKeyword>) to the destination blob properties.

trans-unit.source: If the operation <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword>, the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> header contains an error detail string.
trans-unit.target: If the operation <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword>, the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> header contains an error detail string.

trans-unit.source: A pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation has a 2 week timeout.
trans-unit.target: A pending <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation has a 2 week timeout.

trans-unit.source: A copy attempt that has not completed after 2 weeks times out and leaves an empty blob with the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> field set to <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword> and the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> set to 500 (OperationCancelled).
trans-unit.target: A copy attempt that has not completed after 2 weeks times out and leaves an empty blob with the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> field set to <languageKeyword>failed</languageKeyword> and the <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> set to 500 (OperationCancelled).

trans-unit.source: Intermittent, non-fatal errors that can occur during a copy might impede progress of the copy but not cause it to fail.
trans-unit.target: Intermittent, non-fatal errors that can occur during a copy might impede progress of the copy but not cause it to fail.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> describes the intermittent errors.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> describes the intermittent errors.

trans-unit.source: Any attempt to modify or snapshot the destination blob during the copy will fail with <embeddedLabel>409 (Conflict) Copy Blob in Progress</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Any attempt to modify or snapshot the destination blob during the copy will fail with <embeddedLabel>409 (Conflict) Copy Blob in Progress</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If you call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Abort Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, you will see a <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status:aborted</parameterReference> header and the destination blob will have intact metadata and a blob length of zero bytes.
trans-unit.target: If you call the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Abort Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, you will see a <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status:aborted</parameterReference> header and the destination blob will have intact metadata and a blob length of zero bytes.

trans-unit.source: You can repeat the original call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to try the copy again.
trans-unit.target: You can repeat the original call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> to try the copy again.

trans-unit.source: Billing
trans-unit.target: Billing

trans-unit.source: The destination account of a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is charged for one transaction to initiate the copy, and also incurs one transaction for each request to abort or request the status of the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: The destination account of a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Copy Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is charged for one transaction to initiate the copy, and also incurs one transaction for each request to abort or request the status of the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: When the source blob is in another account, the source account incurs transaction costs.
trans-unit.target: When the source blob is in another account, the source account incurs transaction costs.

trans-unit.source: In addition, if the source and destination accounts reside in different regions (e.g., US North and US South), bandwidth used to transfer the request is charged to the source storage account as egress.
trans-unit.target: In addition, if the source and destination accounts reside in different regions (e.g., US North and US South), bandwidth used to transfer the request is charged to the source storage account as egress.

trans-unit.source: Egress between accounts within the same region is free.
trans-unit.target: Egress between accounts within the same region is free.

trans-unit.source: When you copy a source blob to a destination blob with a different name within the same account, you use additional storage resources for the new blob, so the copy operation results in a charge against the storage account’s capacity usage for those additional resources.
trans-unit.target: When you copy a source blob to a destination blob with a different name within the same account, you use additional storage resources for the new blob, so the copy operation results in a charge against the storage account’s capacity usage for those additional resources.

trans-unit.source: However, if the source and destination blob name are the same within the same account (for example, when you promote a snapshot to its base blob), no additional charge is incurred other than the extra copy metadata stored in version 2012-02-12 and newer.
trans-unit.target: However, if the source and destination blob name are the same within the same account (for example, when you promote a snapshot to its base blob), no additional charge is incurred other than the extra copy metadata stored in version 2012-02-12 and newer.

trans-unit.source: When you promote a snapshot to replace its base blob, the snapshot and base blob become identical.
trans-unit.target: When you promote a snapshot to replace its base blob, the snapshot and base blob become identical.

trans-unit.source: They share blocks or pages, so the copy operation does not result in an additional charge against the storage account's capacity usage.
trans-unit.target: They share blocks or pages, so the copy operation does not result in an additional charge against the storage account's capacity usage.

trans-unit.source: However, if you copy a snapshot to a destination blob with a different name, an additional charge is incurred for the storage resources used by the new blob that results.
trans-unit.target: However, if you copy a snapshot to a destination blob with a different name, an additional charge is incurred for the storage resources used by the new blob that results.

trans-unit.source: Two blobs with different names cannot share blocks or pages even if they are identical.
trans-unit.target: Two blobs with different names cannot share blocks or pages even if they are identical.

trans-unit.source: For more information about snapshot cost scenarios, see <link xlink:href="1f59392b-419a-4436-895e-1025a55ae70c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding How Snapshots Accrue Charges</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about snapshot cost scenarios, see <link xlink:href="1f59392b-419a-4436-895e-1025a55ae70c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding How Snapshots Accrue Charges</link>.
